column4: Hey, I'm having a weird problem with my sound.  My sound works with headphones plugged in, but i can't get it to work through my laptop speakers.  Can anyone help?
do you have intel audio?
yes i think i do
00:1b.0 Audio device: Intel Corporation 5 Series/3400 Series Chipset High Definition Audio (rev 06)
I've got the same problem with both 10.04 and 10.10. And what laptop type?
it's an asus g53jw
The following partially fixed my problem, but still sometimes I don't have sound.
sudo gedit /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base.conf
and at the bottom:
addthis line: options snd-intel8x0 model=laptop
and this: options snd-intel8x0 position_fix=1 enable=yes
ok sorry. so then gksudo or gksu
do i have to restart after that?
yes, but its possible a logout-login will do it. I restarted
all right, i'll give it a try. Thank you.
Hope it will help :)
no luck :(
ok then theres a lot more option you can try adding to the bottom, just have to search for the forum I found it myself...
It doesn't work for me too properly still, but if I don't have sound at startup, I suspend my laptop and after waking it up I have sound
gonna try playing with the model options some more. If I find something that fixes it, I'll let you know.
yes the model options, I know I didn't found an option for my msi laptop :(
